text: arm produces intellectual property or IP
for the semiconductor business seventy
percent of the world's population uses
technology that has arms IP in it just
like every other technology company
we're constantly battling the market
pressures and trying to make sure that
we can get out there ahead of the other
guys having a cloud environment that's
hosted by AWS gives us the ability to
make specific decisions about how much
we compute resource we want to use
whereas in the past we may have been
limited by the total number of servers
that we have in our arm from data center
now that we have cloud capability we can
you know burst into the cloud and we can
make an explicit decision about when we
do that and we're operating our
engineering platform more efficiently
but also freeing up the engineering
resources if we can see you know an 8x
or a 10x improvement and turnaround time
like we've seen when we're running our
EDA workflows in the cloud then our
engineers they do their job you know
like in one week instead of eight weeks
or something like that it gives them so
much more opportunity to be innovative
right and you know instead of chained to
the compute they have an opportunity to
explore new things and to look at
additional product and technology that
we can take to market faster so it's
it's it's really beneficial on multiple
fronts but I think as a leader of the
engineering team at arm I think that
that's where we really see the benefit
is you know freeing up our engineers so
that they can so that they can innovate
